Class Thesaurus

  • java.lang.Object
    • Thesaurus

  • public class Thesaurus
extends java.lang.Object
    For Q2 part a: This Thesaurus class can be used to look up the alternative words of a given word, also known as a synonym. New synonyms can be added to the thesaurus and it can change synonyms in a given sentence. Synonyms can also be cross-referenced.
    Version:
    (05/02/2022)
    Author:
    (Steven Baker)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Thesaurus()
      For Q2 part c: Constructor for objects of class Thesaurus with zero parameters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addSynonym(java.lang.String aWord, java.lang.String aSynonym)
      For Q2 part g: This method adds a new synonym to the thesaurus.
      void crossReference()
      For Q2 part i: This method causes each synonym to be cross-referenced in the thesaurus, further populating the thesaurus by adding values and keys and visa versa.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>> getThesaurus()
      For Q2 part d: For testing purposes, this is a getter method that returns the synonyms map.
      void populate()
      For Q2 part e: Also for testing purposes, this method puts two sample (key-value) entries into a map.
      void print()
      For Q2 part f: This method prints out the whole thesaurus in the form of a word, that is the key value, followed by its synonyms.
      void replaceWord(java.lang.String aWord, java.lang.String aSentence)
      For Q2 part h: This method prints out new variations of aSentence.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • Thesaurus

        public Thesaurus()
        For Q2 part c: Constructor for objects of class Thesaurus with zero parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • addSynonym

        public void addSynonym(java.lang.String aWord,
                       java.lang.String aSynonym)
        For Q2 part g: This method adds a new synonym to the thesaurus.
        Parameters:
        aWord - A String of the word to add to or update the thesaurus.
        aSynonym - A String of the synonym of the given word.

      • crossReference

        public void crossReference()
        For Q2 part i: This method causes each synonym to be cross-referenced in the thesaurus, further populating the thesaurus by adding values and keys and visa versa.

      • getThesaurus

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.util.HashSet<java.lang.String>> getThesaurus()
        For Q2 part d: For testing purposes, this is a getter method that returns the synonyms map.
        Returns:
        A HashMap of the thesaurus.

      • populate

        public void populate()
        For Q2 part e: Also for testing purposes, this method puts two sample (key-value) entries into a map.

      • print

        public void print()
        For Q2 part f: This method prints out the whole thesaurus in the form of a word, that is the key value, followed by its synonyms.

      • replaceWord

        public void replaceWord(java.lang.String aWord,
                        java.lang.String aSentence)
        For Q2 part h: This method prints out new variations of aSentence. The inputed word is replaced by a different synonym.
        Parameters:
        aWord - A String of the word that should be replaced.
        aSentence - A String of a sentance that has the word to replace.
